attributes.gcd: Refers to the date on which the mapping of the mitigant ends for the associated account. According to BECRIS definition, it means the end date for the protection for the instrument.
Refers to the date on which the mapping of the mitigant starts for the associated account.

Refers to the unique identifier of the account or contract held by the customer. Account number is defined as numbers, letters or alphanumeric code assigned to every significant customer, supplier and lender for ease of reference in accounting records of the financial institution.
Refers to the date as on which the snapshot of source data extracted for processing.

attributes.logicalName: Borrower Risk Dependent On Mitigant Flag
attributes.gcd: Flag indicates whether the risk of the borrower is materially dependent on the mitigant. List of values are Y, N. A value of Y indicates that the risk of the borrower is dependent on the mitigant, and any cash flows from the mitigant will be used by the borrower to repay the debt. This is used for credit risk mitigation eligibility check related to EBA CRD IV guidelines pertaining to Article 199.

Refers to the source system from where data is extracted. Data can be sourced from multiple sources, this column will Refers to the source code from where the data is extracted for this extraction date.

Flag indicates if the exposure has a double default. Double default is explained as a case where both the obligor and the guarantor defaults. The CRM treatment is different for exposures which comes under the double default category.

Flag indicates whether there is an Explicit Adjustment for Effective Maturity or not. List of values are Y, N. If the value is updated as Y this will be used for the computation of effective maturity and if the value is updated as N this column will not be used.

ISO currency codes is a standard published by the International Organization for Standardization 4217, which delineates currency designators and country codes, alpha and numeric. This column will capture the standardized currency code. Currency dimension is the equivalent dimension table for this column.

Refers to the load run identifier. Load run identifier enables user to load multiple versions intraday or post back dated adjustment entries to the table. Refers to the Load run identifier of the equivalent record in product processor that needs to be adjusted. Default value of  1 indicates that the latest load run is being adjusted.

Refers to the unique of the collateral or mitigant. In case of derivatives such as Futures and options, collateral such as bonds, letters of credit, Stocks, Exchange traded funds, precious metals etc. can be provided as collateral or mitigant. In case of Lease contracts, operating lease, the collateral or mitigant is the asset being leased. Dim_Mitigant is the equivalent dimension table for this column.
Flag indicates whether the Mitigant is eligible as per Basel II guidelines. List of values are Y, N.
Refers to the credit derivative Mitigants to be pooled based on the Exposure and Mitigant.
Refers to the Mitigant Value at origination in Natural Currency.

attributes.logicalName: Mitigant Value Dependent On Obligor Flag
attributes.gcd: Flag indicates whether the mitigant value is materially dependent on the credit quality of the obligor. List of values are Y, N. A value of Y indicates that the mitigant value is dependent on the credit quality of obligor, and any change in the credit quality of obligor will impact the mitigant valuation. This is used for credit risk mitigation eligibility check related to EBA CRD IV guidelines pertaining to Article 199.
Refers to the Mitigant in case the Mitigant is shared between multiple accounts. Weightage is specified proportionate to the amount. For example, Collateral amount of each Contract.

Refers to the lien position code at origination. Refers to the type of underlying note on the loan. This is also known as the lien position. First mortgage is a mortgage in a first lien position on the property that secures the mortgage. A first mortgage has priority over all other liens or claims on a property in the event of default. If the loan to value, LTV, ratio of a first mortgage is greater than 80 percentage, lenders generally require private mortgage insurance, PMI. In such a case, it can sometimes be economical for a borrower to limit the size of the first mortgage to an 80 percentage LTV and use secondary financing to borrow the remaining amount needed.
Flag indicates whether the referenced mitigant is primary mitigant or not. A value Y means the mitigant is primary mitigant. List of values are Y, N.
Refers to the record creation date. It has been added to all catalog entities to enable partitioning and archival.
Refers to the contractually required collateral or mitigant value expressed as a percentage of the loan amount.
Refers to the run identifier for a set of Records participating in the particular Run with the Run Execution identifier. This is a combination of Run Main Identifier and Run Execution Identifier.
